project.name: Task Manager
project.description: Build a simple todo list application platform for personal task management serving 100+ active users. Key features: create tasks, mark complete, organize by categories, due dates, priority levels, search and filter. Scale to small team usage with real-time sync and ensure basic authentication and data privacy compliance.

endpoints.description: Create a new task - POST /api/v1/tasks (Auth Required)
Get a task by ID - GET /api/v1/tasks/{id} (Auth Required)
Create a new category - POST /api/v1/categories (Auth Required)
Get a category by ID - GET /api/v1/categories/{id} (Auth Required)
Create a new tag - POST /api/v1/tags (Auth Required)
Get a tag by ID - GET /api/v1/tags/{id} (Auth Required)
Create a new setting - POST /api/v1/settings (Auth Required)
Get a setting by ID - GET /api/v1/settings/{id} (Auth Required)

restIssues: /api/v1/settings/{id} and similar endpoints in other groups do not follow the standard REST practice of using plural nouns for collection endpoints and singular nouns for individual resource endpoints. Consider changing to /api/v1/setting/{id}

/api/v1/tasks, /api/v1/categories, /api/v1/tags, and /api/v1/settings do not specify the type of data being returned. Consider adding a query parameter or a separate endpoint for filtering, e.g., /api/v1/tasks?filter=completed
securityRecommendations: /api/v1/auth/login and /api/v1/auth/register should implement rate limiting and IP blocking to prevent brute-force attacks
/api/v1/tasks/{id}, /api/v1/categories/{id}, /api/v1/tags/{id}, and /api/v1/settings/{id} should validate user permissions before allowing updates or deletions
All endpoints should use HTTPS to encrypt data in transit
missingEndpoints: /api/v1/tasks/{id}/assign to assign a task to a user
/api/v1/categories/{id}/tasks to get tasks in a specific category
/api/v1/tags/{id}/tasks to get tasks with a specific tag
/api/v1/settings/{id}/reset to reset a setting to its default value
aiInsights.rateLimiting: Apply rate limiting to /api/v1/auth/login, /api/v1/auth/register, and /api/v1/tasks/{id} endpoints to prevent abuse and denial-of-service attacks
aiInsights.versioning: The current versioning pattern is based on the URI path, using /api/v1/ as the prefix. This is a common approach, but consider using header-based versioning (e.g., Accept: application/vnd.taskmanager.v1+json) for more flexibility and easier maintenance

decisions.title: Database Selection
decisions.description: Choose the best database solution for storing task data, user information, and real-time sync with strong ACID compliance and query performance

recommendations.name: PostgreSQL
recommendations.description: Advanced open-source relational database with excellent ACID compliance, rich feature set including JSON support, full-text search, and extensibility through custom functions and extensions
pros: Rich feature set with JSON and JSONB support
cons: Steeper learning curve compared to MySQL

pricing.details: Free to use, hosting and infrastructure costs vary

recommendations.name: Amazon Aurora
recommendations.description: Cloud-native relational database with MySQL and PostgreSQL compatibility, offering 5x performance improvement with automated backups, auto-scaling storage, and multi-AZ deployments

pricing.details: Pay for compute, storage, and I/O separately. Costs scale with usage.

recommendations.name: MongoDB
recommendations.description: Document-oriented NoSQL database with flexible schema design, horizontal scaling capabilities, and rich query language for handling unstructured data

pricing.details: Community edition free, Enterprise features and Atlas managed service paid

recommendations.name: MySQL
recommendations.description: Popular open-source relational database known for reliability, ease of use, and wide adoption in web applications with strong read performance

pricing.details: Free and open-source, hosting costs vary

decisions.reasoning: PostgreSQL is recommended for this task manager application due to its strong ACID compliance ensuring data integrity for transactions, excellent support for complex queries needed for task management, and JSON support for flexible task attributes. The open-source nature keeps costs low while providing enterprise-grade features. Strong community support and extensive documentation reduce development risk.

decisions.title: Cloud Infrastructure Selection
decisions.description: Select the cloud platform that will host the entire application infrastructure, providing compute, storage, networking, and managed services

recommendations.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
recommendations.description: Leading cloud platform with the most comprehensive service portfolio including EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, and 200+ services for building scalable applications
pros: Largest service portfolio in the industry
cons: Complex pricing can be difficult to predict

pricing.details: Pay-as-you-go for most services, reserved instances available for cost savings

recommendations.name: Google Cloud Platform
recommendations.description: Google's cloud platform with strong AI/ML capabilities, competitive pricing, and excellent Kubernetes support through GKE

pricing.details: Generally 20-30% cheaper than AWS for compute and storage with sustained use discounts

recommendations.name: Microsoft Azure
recommendations.description: Microsoft's cloud platform with excellent enterprise integration, strong hybrid cloud capabilities, and deep integration with Microsoft products

pricing.details: Competitive with AWS, good discounts for Microsoft customers with Enterprise Agreements

decisions.reasoning: AWS is recommended as the cloud provider due to its comprehensive service portfolio that can support all components of the task manager application, mature ecosystem with proven reliability at scale, and strong marketplace for third-party integrations. While pricing is complex, the extensive documentation and large community make it easier to optimize costs. The global presence ensures low latency for customers worldwide.

decisions.title: API Gateway Selection
decisions.description: Choose the API gateway that will handle incoming requests, provide security, and route traffic to backend services

recommendations.name: AWS API Gateway
recommendations.description: Fully managed API gateway with REST, WebSocket, and HTTP APIs, supporting Lambda, EC2, and Elastic Beanstalk integrations
pros: Support for REST, WebSocket, and HTTP APIs
Security features like IAM roles and API keys

pricing.details: Pay for API calls, data transfer, and cache storage

recommendations.name: Kong
recommendations.description: Open-source API gateway with service discovery, load balancing, and security features, supporting multiple protocols and plug-ins
pros: Security features like authentication and rate limiting

pricing.details: Free to use, support and enterprise features paid

recommendations.name: NGINX
recommendations.description: Popular open-source web server with API gateway capabilities, supporting load balancing, caching, and security features
pros: Support for load balancing and caching
Security features like SSL/TLS and access control

pricing.details: Free to use, support and enterprise features paid

decisions.reasoning: AWS API Gateway is recommended for its tight integration with AWS services, support for REST, WebSocket, and HTTP APIs, and security features like IAM roles and API keys. The scalability and high availability ensure that the API gateway can handle a large volume of requests.

decisions.title: Authentication Service Selection
decisions.description: Choose the authentication service that will handle user authentication and authorization

recommendations.name: AWS Cognito
recommendations.description: Fully managed authentication service with user pools, identity pools, and federated identities, supporting multiple protocols and integrations
pros: Security features like MFA and password policies

pricing.details: Pay for active users, data storage, and SMS messages

recommendations.name: Auth0
recommendations.description: Universal authentication platform with social login, MFA, and passwordless authentication, supporting multiple protocols and integrations

pricing.details: Pay for active users, features, and support

recommendations.name: Okta
recommendations.description: Cloud-based identity and access management platform with single sign-on, MFA, and user lifecycle management, supporting multiple protocols and integrations

pricing.details: Pay for active users, features, and support

decisions.reasoning: AWS Cognito is recommended for its tight integration with AWS services, support for multiple protocols, and security features like MFA and password policies. The scalability and high availability ensure that the authentication service can handle a large volume of requests.

decisions.title: Cache Layer Selection
decisions.description: Choose the cache layer that will improve application performance by reducing database queries and improving response times

recommendations.name: Redis
recommendations.description: In-memory data store with high performance, supporting multiple data structures and protocols

pricing.details: Free to use, support and enterprise features paid

recommendations.name: Memcached
recommendations.description: High-performance, distributed memory object caching system with simple protocol and small codebase
cons: No support for multiple data structures

pricing.details: Free to use, support and enterprise features paid

recommendations.name: Amazon ElastiCache
recommendations.description: Fully managed in-memory cache service with support for Redis and Memcached, offering high performance and low latency
pros: Fully managed service with automatic patching and backups

pricing.details: Pay for cache node hours, data transfer, and storage

decisions.reasoning: Redis is recommended for its high performance and low latency, support for multiple data structures, and pub/sub messaging and transactions. The open-source nature and large community ensure that the cache layer can be customized and extended as needed.

decisions.title: Search Engine Selection
decisions.description: Choose the search engine that will provide full-text search capabilities for the application

recommendations.name: Elasticsearch
recommendations.description: Popular open-source search and analytics engine with high performance, scalability, and support for multiple data formats
cons: Limited support for non-search use cases

pricing.details: Free to use, support and enterprise features paid

recommendations.name: Apache Solr
recommendations.description: Popular open-source search engine with high performance, scalability, and support for multiple data formats
cons: Limited support for non-search use cases

pricing.details: Free to use, support and enterprise features paid

recommendations.name: Amazon CloudSearch
recommendations.description: Fully managed search service with support for multiple data formats, offering high performance and scalability
pros: Fully managed service with automatic patching and backups

pricing.details: Pay for search instance hours, data transfer, and storage

decisions.reasoning: Elasticsearch is recommended for its high performance and scalability, support for multiple data formats, and full-text search and filtering capabilities. The open-source nature and large community ensure that the search engine can be customized and extended as needed.

decisions.title: Load Balancer Selection
decisions.description: Choose the load balancer that will distribute incoming traffic across multiple instances

recommendations.name: NGINX
recommendations.description: Popular open-source web server with load balancing capabilities, supporting multiple protocols and configurations

pricing.details: Free to use, support and enterprise features paid

recommendations.name: HAProxy
recommendations.description: Popular open-source load balancer with high performance, scalability, and support for multiple protocols

pricing.details: Free to use, support and enterprise features paid

recommendations.name: Amazon ELB
recommendations.description: Fully managed load balancer with support for multiple protocols, offering high performance and scalability
pros: Fully managed service with automatic patching and backups

pricing.details: Pay for load balancer hours, data transfer, and storage

decisions.reasoning: NGINX is recommended for its high performance and scalability, support for multiple protocols, and load balancing and caching capabilities. The open-source nature and large community ensure that the load balancer can be customized and extended as needed.

decisions.title: CI/CD Pipeline Selection
decisions.description: Choose the CI/CD pipeline that will automate build, test, and deployment workflows

recommendations.name: GitHub Actions
recommendations.description: Integrated CI/CD platform built into GitHub with workflow automation, rich marketplace of actions, and seamless integration with repositories
cons: Pricing for private repos can add up

pricing.details: Free for public repos, pay-per-use for private repos (2,000 free minutes/month)

recommendations.name: GitLab CI/CD
recommendations.description: Integrated DevOps platform with built-in CI/CD, security scanning, container registry, and comprehensive deployment capabilities

pricing.details: Free tier available, paid plans for advanced features (400 CI/CD minutes free)

recommendations.name: Jenkins
recommendations.description: Leading open-source automation server with extensive plugin ecosystem for building complex CI/CD pipelines

pricing.details: Free to use, infrastructure costs for hosting servers

decisions.reasoning: GitHub Actions is recommended for its tight integration with GitHub repositories, ease of setup with YAML workflows, and rich marketplace of pre-built actions. The low complexity and excellent documentation enable rapid implementation. Free tier for public repositories provides cost-effective starting point, and the platform scales well as the project grows.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement Microservices Architecture
smartRecommendations.description: Break down the application into smaller services for tasks, categories, and authentication to improve maintainability, scalability, and fault tolerance. Use RESTful APIs for communication between services.

smartRecommendations.title: Use Redis for Real-time Sync
smartRecommendations.description: Utilize Redis as a message broker to enable real-time synchronization of tasks across users. Implement pub/sub messaging pattern to notify clients of updates.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement JWT-based Authentication
smartRecommendations.description: Use JSON Web Tokens (JWT) for authentication and authorization. Generate tokens upon user login and validate them on each request to ensure secure access to tasks and categories.

smartRecommendations.title: Optimize Database Queries with Indexing
smartRecommendations.description: Create indexes on frequently queried columns such as task due dates, categories, and priority levels to improve query performance. Use EXPLAIN statements to analyze and optimize queries.

smartRecommendations.title: Use Elasticsearch for Search and Filter
smartRecommendations.description: Integrate Elasticsearch to provide efficient search and filter functionality for tasks. Index task data and use Elasticsearch queries to retrieve relevant results.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement Data Encryption and Access Control
smartRecommendations.description: Encrypt sensitive data such as user passwords and task descriptions. Implement role-based access control to restrict access to tasks and categories based on user roles and permissions.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Create indexes on frequently queried columns
optimizationSuggestions.description: Create indexes on columns like task_id, user_id, category_id, due_date, and priority_level to improve query performance. This will speed up tasks like searching, filtering, and retrieving tasks for a specific user or category.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement Redis caching for frequently accessed data
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use Redis to cache frequently accessed data like user information, category lists, and task counts. This will reduce the load on the database and improve response times for users.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Optimize database queries for task retrieval
optimizationSuggestions.description: Optimize database queries to retrieve tasks for a specific user or category. Use efficient query techniques like pagination, lazy loading, and query caching to reduce the load on the database.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Use a load balancer to distribute traffic
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use a load balancer to distribute traffic across multiple instances of the application. This will improve responsiveness and ensure that the application can handle a large number of concurrent users.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement rate limiting and IP blocking
optimizationSuggestions.description: Implement rate limiting and IP blocking to prevent brute-force attacks and denial-of-service (DoS) attacks. This will help protect the application from malicious users and ensure that legitimate users can access the application.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Schedule regular database backups and cleanups
optimizationSuggestions.description: Schedule regular database backups and cleanups to ensure that the application's data is safe and up-to-date. This will also help to prevent data corruption and ensure that the application can recover quickly in case of a disaster.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement monitoring and alerting for application performance
optimizationSuggestions.description: Implement monitoring and alerting for application performance to quickly identify and respond to issues. Use tools like New Relic, Datadog, or Prometheus to monitor application performance and set up alerts for issues like slow queries, high error rates, or high latency.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Strong Password Policies
securityRecommendations.description: Enforce password length, complexity, and rotation policies to prevent brute-force attacks. Ensure passwords are stored securely using a salted hash.

securityRecommendations.title: Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
securityRecommendations.description: Add an extra layer of security by requiring users to provide a second form of verification, such as a code sent to their phone or a biometric scan, in addition to their password.

securityRecommendations.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data
securityRecommendations.description: Use end-to-end encryption to protect user data, both in transit and at rest. This includes task descriptions, due dates, and other sensitive information.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
securityRecommendations.description: Assign roles to users and restrict access to features and data based on their role. For example, team administrators should have more access than regular users.

securityRecommendations.title: Regularly Update and Patch Dependencies
securityRecommendations.description: Keep all dependencies, including frameworks, libraries, and plugins, up-to-date with the latest security patches to prevent known vulnerabilities from being exploited.

securityRecommendations.title: Monitor and Log Security-Related Events
securityRecommendations.description: Implement logging and monitoring to detect and respond to security incidents, such as login attempts, data access, and system changes.
